result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua James Klinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation no later than October 8, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Court has no objection to Defendant serving Probation in Minnesota but up to Agent, not the Court.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF292.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF292.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Patricia Klinger.
-Complete a Mental Health Assessment and comply and follow through with all recommendations.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to 14CF34.
-Consecutive to Barron County Case #16CF177.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to 14CF34 and Consecutive to Barron County Case #16CF177

superMiscConds.notes: Not to use or possess firearms.

***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman December 17, 2020 - Remove the NC with Patricia K.

-Reduce fines to a civil judgment.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Complete a Mental Health Assessment. Comply and follow through with recommendations.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF34 and 15CF292:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Matthew Z Kirkpatrick   DF:  Joshua James Klinger appeared from jail. Probation Agent Stephanie Engel present. Case called at 9:55 a.m. Court notes these matters are set for a Sentencing Hearing on Revocation. Both parties have reviewed the revocation and warrant. No corrections need to be made. ADA Ellenwood gives sentencing arguments. Atty Kirkpatrick gives sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. State or defense could request additional jail credit if applicable.

Court orders:

TOTAL IC 4 YEARS. 2 years IC, 2 years EC. 36 day jail credit.

14CF34 and 15CF292 to run concurrent and sentence to run consecutive to Barron Co Case 16CF177.

- Reduce all fines to a civil judgment. Any amount collected by probation or any prison wages may apply

- DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   Not to use or possess firearms.

-   Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Patricia Klinger.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

- Complete a mental health assessment. Comply and follow through with recommendations

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF34, 15CF292 and 15CF415:

- Must report to probation no later than 4 p.m. on October 8, 2015 

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Patricia K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF34, 15CF292 and 15CF415:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Joshua James Klinger appeared from jail. Case called at 4:26 p.m. ADA McKinley gives recommendations. State has complied with all victim requirements.  Atty Yacoub in agreement, argues the court costs. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 in 14CF34. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 in 15CF292. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 3 in 15CF415 DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF34, Ct 1 in 15CF292 and Ct 3 in 15CF415. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 2 in 15CF415. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:   

- S/W 3 years probation. Court has no objection to defendant serving probation in MN but up to probation agent, not the court. Must report to probation by no later than 4 p.m. on October 8, 2015. Bond will be converted to a $1,000 signature bond . 15CF415 credit of 40 days

- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Patricia Klinger.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Complete a mental health assessment.  Comply and follow through with recommendations

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Provide DNA Sample and Pay Surcharge

- Court costs to be paid over the course of probation 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
for Order of Specialized Care filed by Atty Yacoub. Order UNSIGNED by RMW. hml

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF415, 15CF292, and 14CF34:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Joshua James Klinger appeared from jail. Atty Elizabeth Rohl appears for Corporation Counsel. Case called 2:38 p.m. Court reviews Motion filed by Atty Yacoub for sheriff to provide specialized medical care for defendant. Atty Yacoub gives argument. Atty Rohl gives response. Speaking with ADA McKinley there is a resolution and there may be a possibility for moving up the plea hearing. Atty Yacoub gives argument. ADA McKinley gives position. State did not object to the bond amendment prior but can not approve another signature bond. Victim notice is required and they have been in contact. Court is going to deny the motion for the sheriff's office to provide specialized care. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

O ALSO INCLUDE 15CF292, 14CF34 and 15CF415:
CO: RMW, REP:Deiss, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Joshua James Klinger appeared from jail. Case called at 1:20 p.m. Atty Yacoub filed Motion for a Medical Furlough for defendant. ADA Mckinley does not object to furlough or amended bond for this specific problem. One person needs to be responsible for Mr. Klinger and defendant to be returned to SCCJ within 1 hour of discharge. DA's office also requesting contact information for individual that is transporting Mr. Klinger and documentation on the care received by Mr. Klinger. There is victims rights that need to be dealt with in this matter. The victim witness office is trying to get in touch with the victim. Court will not grant furlough but will amend bond. Once returned to jail, cash bond will be reinstated. Case recalled at 1:57 p.m. Ms. Anderson will not be able to appear to the Clerk of Court to co-sign the bond. Court will remove the co-signer and will amend bond for defendant to be released to Ms. Anderson.

- TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF292, 15CF415 and 14CF34

-  Defendant must be released to Michelle Anderson and to be transported to Amery Regional Medical Center. 

- Defendant must return to jail no later than 1 hour after discharge from hospital, voluntarily or involuntarily. Defendant then will be subject to the $500 cash bond. 

- Defendant must sign release to the DA's office to receive verification of defendant's treatment
